home.title: We’re getting married!
home.intro: We are so excited to celebrate our special day with you in beautiful Murcia, Spain! Your presence would mean the world to us. We cannot wait to celebrate our love surrounded by cherished family and friends from all around the world.

ceremony.title: Ceremony & Reception
ceremony.dresscode: We kindly ask guests to dress in semi-formal attire. Suits and ties, dresses and generally elegant outfits are encouraged. It’s not a black-tie event, so no need for tuxedos or floor-length gowns — but we’d love everyone to feel dressed up for the occasion. Please refrain from wearing white or white-adjacent colours. Since the celebration will be outdoors in the Spanish sunshine, lighter fabrics and bright colours are encouraged. If choosing to wear heels, you may wish to choose wedges or block heels instead of stilettos.

guests.children: We love your little ones, but our wedding will be for adults and teens only. We kindly ask that toddlers and small infants sit this one out — partly because of venue rules, and partly so everyone can eat, drink, and dance without worrying about naptimes!
guests.plusOnes: We have set up the RSVP so that one person per party can fill it in. Please note wedding invitations are only extended to established couples, and single people are not allowed a plus one.

travel.title: Travel & Stay
travel.airports: Murcia is easily reached from the UK, with regular flights. The nearest airport is Región de Murcia International (RMU), about 30 minutes from the city. Alicante (ALC) is also a great option, about an hour away.
travel.accommodation: We recommend staying near the city centre if possible. We will be running a bus to and from the wedding, so easy access will help you find your way back afterwards.
travel.weather: Late May in Murcia is warm, with daytime 20-25°C and cooler nights of 12-16°C. Expect sunshine and low humidity. Bring light clothes and SPF.

tips.language: Spanish people love when you try their language, even just a few words.
tips.food: Lunch is eaten around 14:00-15:00, the main meal of the day. Dinner starts from 20:00 onwards.
tips.general: Service is relaxed, tipping is minimal (rounding up or 1-2€ is plenty).

honeymoon.title: Honeymoon Fund
honeymoon.text: We feel incredibly grateful that so many of you are travelling to Spain to celebrate with us. Please know that we do not expect any gifts — your company on the day is what matters most. If you would still like to give something, a contribution to our honeymoon fund would mean the world to us.
